definition: to shout loudly/to raise a cry/to yell
to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)

sentences.english: President Bush's remarks were disrupted several times by shouting protesters.
sentences.chinese: 布希總統的講話幾次被高喊口號的抗議者打斷。

sentences.english: Because Qin has shouted loudly prays for rescue, Sun then chokes to death it.
sentences.chinese: 由於秦某一直高喊求救，孫某便將其掐死。

sentences.english: The embarrassed-looking Ms. Zhang accepted the proposal as the crowd chanted 'Marry him!'
sentences.chinese: 人羣高喊“嫁給他”，羞澀的張新宇答應了。

sentences.english: The stars drove through streets heaving with frantic fans.
sentences.chinese: 影星們駕車在街道上駛過，瘋狂的影迷們狂呼高喊。

sentences.english: These crowds shouted "running dogs" in Cantonese at those championing democracy.
sentences.chinese: 人們用廣東話對那些帶頭的民主派們高喊“走狗”。

sentences.english: Lron shouted, looking for support from the other XTs.
sentences.chinese: 勒榮高喊，尋求其他外星人的支持。

definition: to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)
to sing loudly/fig. to mouth slogans
Long live (the king, the revolution etc)!/Your Majesty/His Majesty
